intro: Antennaria wiegandii, commonly known as the Wiegand's mouse-eared carpet, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and inconspicuous yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Antennaria wiegandii is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and endemic species in parts of its range.
